user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of internal_add_connection:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
internal_add_connection (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
                         MHD_socket client_socket,
                         const struct sockaddr_storage *addr,
                         socklen_t addrlen,
                         bool external_add,
                         bool non_blck,
                         bool sk_spipe_supprs,
                         enum MHD_tristate sk_is_nonip)
{
  struct MHD_Connection *connection;

#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  /* Direct add to master daemon could never happen. */
  mhd_assert (NULL == daemon->worker_pool);
#endif

  if (MHD_D_IS_USING_SELECT_ (daemon) &&
      (! MHD_D_DOES_SCKT_FIT_FDSET_ (client_socket, daemon)) )
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("New connection socket descriptor (%d) is not less " \
                 "than FD_SETSIZE (%d).\n"),
              (int) client_socket,
              (int) MHD_D_GET_FD_SETSIZE_ (daemon));
#endif
    MHD_socket_close_chk_ (client_socket);
#if defined(ENFILE) && (ENFILE + 0 != 0)
    errno = ENFILE;
#endif
    return MHD_NO;
  }

  if (MHD_D_IS_USING_EPOLL_ (daemon) &&
      (! non_blck) )
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Epoll mode supports only non-blocking sockets\n"));
#endif
    MHD_socket_close_chk_ (client_socket);
#if defined(EINVAL) && (EINVAL + 0 != 0)
    errno = EINVAL;
#endif
    return MHD_NO;
  }

  connection = new_connection_prepare_ (daemon,
                                        client_socket,
                                        addr, addrlen,
                                        external_add,
                                        non_blck,
                                        sk_spipe_supprs,
                                        sk_is_nonip);
  if (NULL == connection)
    return MHD_NO;

  if ((external_add) &&
      MHD_D_IS_THREAD_SAFE_ (daemon))
  {
    /* Connection is added externally and MHD is thread safe mode. */
    MHD_mutex_lock_chk_ (&daemon->new_connections_mutex);
    DLL_insert (daemon->new_connections_head,
                daemon->new_connections_tail,
                connection);
    daemon->have_new = true;
    MHD_mutex_unlock_chk_ (&daemon->new_connections_mutex);

    /* The rest of connection processing must be handled in
     * the daemon thread. */
    if ((MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->itc)) &&
        (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->itc, "n")))
    {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
      MHD_DLOG (daemon,
                _ ("Failed to signal new connection via inter-thread " \
                   "communication channel.\n"));
#endif
    }
    return MHD_YES;
  }

  return new_connection_process_ (daemon, connection);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The remaining code in the function (function entry, the call to new_connection_prepare_, the NULL check and its return, the external_add && MHD_D_IS_THREAD_SAFE_ branch that locks mutex, inserts into lists, sets daemon->have_new, unlocks and returns MHD_YES, and the final return new_connection_process_ call) represents the normal, expected control-flow and is reachable depending on runtime conditions and input parameters. There is no indication of dead code immediately following an unconditional return in the same block or unreachable statements within that core path. Therefore those parts do not need investigation for Rule 2.1. The fragments listed above are flagged because they are conditional on compile-time macros or configuration predicates (or are guarded by comments/assertions claiming a path 'could never happen'), and thus merit investigation to determine whether they can be executed in any build/configuration or are effectively unreachable in the project.
